content.webTitle: Edinburgh comedy podcast: Jack Whitehall and Phil Nichol

fields.headline: Live at the Edinburgh Festival: Jack Whitehall and Phil Nichol
fields.bodyText: Phil Nichol kicks off today's podcast with wit, wordplay and a song designed to offend as many people as possible. It's a taster of his new show at the Stand, A Deadpan Poet Sings Quiet Songs Quietly. Next up is cuddly Glaswegian chef Hardeep Singh Kohli, who is cooking up fun every night at the Gilded Balloon for punters who bring their own ingredients. It's Hardeep's first time at the festival and he's bemused to be sharing a venue with the Chippendales. After a late night on the tiles playing poker with Lucy Porter and his other comedy pals, John Gordillo joins Miles to talk about the basics of Fuckonomics, as outlined in his show at the Pleasance. After all that, how about a bit of romance? Taking a break from serenading Jonathan Ross, 4 Poofs and a Piano have a tinkle with an X-rated ode to the importance of the third date. Bright young spark Jack Whitehall drops in to spread some love to John Gordillo and talk about his dad, beard envy and why he's already over the hill at 21. Finally, Idiots of Ants perform a short sketch for your listening pleasure. We're also giving you the opportunity to perform in front of our live, sold-out audience. If you're an aspiring comedian, enter our comedy competition. And if you're in Edinburgh, we want to see you! Make sure you come to one of our recordings, every weekday at noon at the Gilded Balloon, Teviot Square. Entrance is free but you need a ticket - go to the Fringe box office, or the venue, or call 0131-622 6552. Don't miss an edition: subscribe free via iTunes; or paste this URL into your podcast software of choice.
